reviews.sentence: Almost Perfect. The room was spectacular balcony was an added surprise overlooking a brook. Soothing. Room was immaculate. Wish they had more towels and the ironing board was incredibly broken. Barely got it to do what I needed. The wine and appetizers the breakfast in the morning wowAside from that our stay excluding towels and ironing board could not have been more perfect. The service. So many little places to eat and the LIVE MUSIC at the SHOES AND MUSIC location down the street was cute. Towels and a new ironing board.
Relaxing and peaceful. A very serene small hotel. Loved the nightly wine and snack reception. Great little town.

In the heart of Saratoga. In the heart of Saratoga for shopping restaurants and a park with walking trails. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful and they invited my grandkids to join me at breakfast with no charge even though the kids were not staying at the hotel.

Beautifully furnished rooms a centralized location and most importantly very comfortable beds. The continental breakfast was typical but counterbalanced by an evening wine reception. Overall a great place to stay.

We had a very enjoyable stay and the hotel was definitely a big part of that. The location is great and the bed was VERY comfortable. The facility is getting just a little dated and not in the quaint way. It took a long time for the water to get hot for a shower.

Happy surprise. The front desk person was very cordial upon our arrival. Wine and appetizers were very nice. Breakfast offerings a little dull. Gluten free muffin was blah. Fruit and yogurt saved the day.
What a gem of a place right next to a rushing river. Lots of value for the money.
Amazing Find Just Minutes from San Jose. A full service hotel with a very quaint feel. I travel alone often I felt completely safe here.

The Inn at Saratoga. The hotel is very nice and in a quiet location tucked away behind the main street in Saratoga. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the room I had was spacious and well kept. Saratoga itself is a small town with a village feel. It has lots of restaurants and several cafes and coffee shops but few other shops within walking distance of the hotel. A variety of other shops supermarkets and post office are within a short drive away.
The staff was exceptionally friendly and went out of their way to accommodate their guests. Peacefully and walking distance to great restaurants Bela Saratoga and shops.
The hotel is under total renovation and not fit for guests. Unfortunately it was very late at night when I arrived so I had to stay.

Nice location spoilt by ongoing building work. Good location. There was building work going on and scaffolding in front of the windows. The builders started at 730am every morning which woke us up. We were not told that this work was taking place when we booked and no discount was applied for the inconvenience. Poor customer service and spoilt what would otherwise have been a good stay. I appreciate that the work needs to be done but then either advise the customer at time of booking or compensate them for the aggravation.

The properties under construction from 9 am to 5 pm there was a lot of noise so they may complete the project. So if you have plans on staying in the hotel from 9 am to 5 pm it will be noisy if you are just needed a place to sleep it will be fine construction will not be forever. I like to pay with cash the cashier did not know what to do I was so thankful someone else did. I always have loved Saratoga Inn I was sad to hear that it was purchased by the Hilton. I always enjoyed the homie feel by the mom and pop places. The Hilton hotels are nice they are just not as welcoming.

BORN RAISED LOCAL GAVE THE INN A CHANCE. The hotel was under construction and did not help with our requests to move us. We had a convention around that area and needed it to be quiet just to get sleep between 10 8. But they started at 6 AM and with the time change that did not happen. With the amount of money they charged and did not even apologize I was very disappointed. it is my favorite hotel I was born and raised in Saratoga and very unappreciated as a local.
Ok but should discount rooms during construction. New furnishings. Construction. Mess and smell.

Apprehensive at first so pleased at the end. To be honest once we got to the area we thought about looking for a different hotel due to the level of construction so glad we did not. I wish I remembered the name of the lovely woman who was at the front desk. She was accommodating and so friendly. The room was super quiet even with yard work happening outside large comfortable beds and overall comfortable. The view of the creek will be beautiful one construction is finished. We definitely would love to come back once construction is finished. The area is lovely as well historic Saratoga. Very walkable.

Completely under construction debris everywyere. Hotel is completely under construction. Debris and dirt everywhere. There is not even a lobby just some type of suite or hospitality room on the fourth floor they are using for check in. I did receive a modernization update email from them prior to my stay but in no way did it prepare me for what was underway.

They are undergoing a remodel and rightfully so. The room was a muted decor with a leather recliner that had some patch work from tears. There was a small balcony with one chair and scaffolding around the entire building. The parking lot had storage containers and the construction crew vehicles dominated the parking lot. there is not any real amenities at this location. I recommend staying elsewhere. Also I have stayed at places that say they are under construction this place is really UNDER CONSTRUCTION. Check in is on the 4th floor inside a suite. there is no lobby.

Good. Great bed very comfortable. Love the view of the Creek however there was scaffolding blocking that during the renovation. Confusion as to entry and parking due to renovation that is in progress.

The property is under construction will be for quite a bit longer this was not apparent on the Hotelscom site. it was n’t a big deal. The problem we did have was a broken A C which was given a temporary window unit that still left the room warm stuffy. The 5 ⭐ ️ goes to Maria Res who really stepped up to rectify the situation it was very appreciated. Otherwise great location clean friendly staff. Looking forward to coming back once the construction is done.

I want so bad to give this place 5 stars unfortunately it is in construction like really really in full renovations. We had a very special 24 hour turn around trip gifted for me and a girlfriend to go to a show at the mountain winery and relax. My 1st trip since having a baby and her bachelorette. Instead of staying at a cheap spot by the airport I booked here to stay in the peace over a babbling brooke like the description promised. Our stay cost 318 for 1 night. When we arrived our Uber could nt even find the place it was so covered in construction material. There s no lobby they made a sort of everything room on the 4th floor. We never saw any of the hotel except a n elevator that looked like a service elevator covered in blankets and trash torn up floors a hallway with computer printed signs pointing you to the everything room to check in. The hotel was now booking for half that price but said they could nt honor it due to the 3rd party booking. We asked to cancel and they said it is too late the penalty would be the 1 days cost anyway. We had no car did nt know the area and did nt know if we would get that money back and felt a bit trapped since it was a 1 day trip now half over. We tried to make the best of it but in the morning they started drilling and pounding on our walls at 8 am. The hotel was hot and mucky and it was about 100 degrees outsidethe lights were flickering in our room. the conditioner empty in the shower it just was nt the boutique experience we spent 3 months getting ready for. That all being said in the future I am sure this place will be great. I just felt a bit side lined. The hotel said they had no record of us from the 3rd party which is why they did nt notify us of the construction but they somehow know to charge our card for the 318 before we even checked in. They said it is to preauthorize because they never know what kind of characters are coming through there which is fine but that also to me shows they knew who we were and that we had a reservation as well as they were in control of charging usi do feel bad for the staff being put in this position as I now look at these reviews and see they probably get a hard time from most people during this renovation. And its rightly so since this is nt the place I thought it would be. Once finished they will no doubt have a beautiful hidden gem but I do nt think they should be booking rooms this deep in construction and definitely not at boutique prices. And should maybe have a better plan in action to help out people caught off guard. I do nt write this to discourage you from staying in the future but please check with there current construction status prior to making your reservation so you know exactly what to expectweve asked that the 3rd party booking site make the situation known to guests and they have been kind about trying to make this right after viewing our photos and story. I hope they do make people aware. And some day I would love to see this place in its finished form.
They are under renovations most of the facility is closed. And they still charged the same rate as ever.

It is unfair right now to be too hard on this hotel. They are undergoing a large renovation and continuing to operate as normal. Lobby is in a conference room. Hall are full of construction materials. On a more consistent note the continental breakfast is average. There are few amenities at this property no terrace pool or for now meeting room.
The property was under construction and remodeling but overall service was great.

Could have been great. We anticipated construction noise and that was not nearly an issue as much as the noise from a group of party goers on night one. Rude loud 60 something bday partiers. I asked them to shush at 2 am they went on until well after 4 am. My husband called the night manager who we heard asking the them to go to bed. In the morning my husband addressed the issue again and the response was oh ya sorry we know these folks big party locals. The room was beautiful. Location great. We would have given a better review if 1 the staff had been able to get the rowdy crowd down sooner and 2 if our concerns had been better addressed. A small discount would have been appreciated.

The worst experience I have had staying in Santa Clara. Booked online called to confirm arrival time hours in advance called for 30 mins while driving to confirm the room was ready nobody answered after 5 call attempts arrived at check in the entire place was under renovations and wayfinding to the front desk was misleading. No room was ready staff was very unhelpful and wasted 90minutes for nothing. Chargeback in progress DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME. The entire property is under construction and the elevator was being used to haul drywall and renovations crew between floors. Extremely unprofessional and not worth more than a Motel 6.
What a gem. When I booked this I thought hey it is just close to where I needed to be. It was worth the money. I let the pictures talk for themselves.
Good. Rooms are very nice. No discount for renovations full blown interior construction which was underway.
More effort could have been put into the breakfast area during the refurbishment. The breakfast choice was much more lik. Great location and refurbished rooms. Poor breakfast.
